result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell S. Simonson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant may petition Court in writing, after two years, for expunction of record, contingent upon no new law violations and fine paid in full.

AODA and Comply. 
Submit DNA Sample.

records.addlTxt: and Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief filed by defendant and Atty Southworth.

Defendant Mitchell S. Simonson in court with attorney Scott H Southworth.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Information filed, reading waived.  Rights/Elements.  Defendant plead no contest to Ct. 1.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Ct. 1 withhold sentencing placed on probation for 2 yrs.  AODA and comply.  $278.00 costs, $250.00 DNA sample and surcharge.  Defendant may petition Court in writing, after two years, for expunction of record, contingent upon no new law violations and fine paid in full.  No jail credit.  Ct. 2 Dismissed but read in.
Petition For Leave to File Additional Motions filed by Atty Long
